jMath.linalg
Class Array1D

java.lang.Object
  jMath.linalg.Array1D

public class Array1D
extends java.lang.Object

A class of static methods implementing operations on 1-dimensional arrays Intentionally mimics many of the naming conventions of MATLAB.

Version:
April 1, 2010
Author:
S. Andrew Ning

interp1

public static double interp1(double[] x,
                             double[] y,
                             double xi)
1d linear interpolation to find yi, the approximate value of y(x) at xi. x must already be sorted in ascending order. If xi is not in bounds of interpolation it returns the closest value in y TODO: maybe it would be better to linearly extrapolate? Assumes x and y are the same size.

Parameters:
x -
y -
xi -
Returns:
an interpolated approximation for y(xi)

interp1

public static double[] interp1(double[] x,
                               double[] y,
                               double[] xi)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
1d linear interpolation to approximate y(x) at all of the entries in xi. x must already be sorted in ascending order. If xi is not in the bounds of interpolation it returns value at the closest bound

Parameters:
x -
y -
xi -
Returns:
an interpolated approximation for y(x) at every value in xi
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

find

public static int find(double[] x,
                       double xi)
Checks to see if element xi is in the vector x. Array must be sorted first.

Parameters:
x -
xi -
Returns:
the index of element xi if it is contained in x. -1 otherwise.

find

public static int[] find(double[] x,
                         double[] xi)
Checks to see if the elements of xi are in vector x. Array must be sorted first.

Parameters:
x -
xi -
Returns:
for each entry in xi returns the index it is found in x, or -1 otherwise
